data.details:
Prerequisite: Participants must be Girl Scout Seniors/Ambassadors (9th-12th grade) or adults

The Adult & Pediatric First Aid/CPR/AED course is required for all Level 1 and Level 2 First Aiders. This course contains step-by-step, hands-on training that allows participants to respond effectively in the event of an emergency or life threatening situation. Topics covered will include: response to cardiac and/or breathing emergencies; head, neck, and back injuries; wound management; handling thermal emergencies, and proper use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED). Participants will receive an approved American Red Cross certification that is valid for two years.  Comfortable clothing and shoes are recommended for this course. This course is OSHA compliant.

*This event is for 2016 registered Girl Scouts.
*For safety and supervision reasons, troops and individuals are not permitted to bring non-Girl Scouts or siblings.
*Girl/adult ratios must be followed and adults are expected to stay on the premises during the event.
*Registration closes May 7

$50/girl, $50/adult
Contact: Jacquie Johnson  904.652.1364
